title: Handedness

***Version [0.29](/0.29 "0.29")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

Each weapon has a particular **handedness**, which determines how well you can wield it based on your [size](/Size "Size"), and whether or not you can use a [shield](/Shield "Shield").

## Contents

- [2 Shields](#Shields)
- [3 Rings](#Rings)
- [4 History](#History)

- [Felids](/Felid "Felid") lack opposable thumbs and cannot wield weapons, throw items, or evoke [magical staves](/Magical_staves "Magical staves").

- [Spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") are little and [Kobolds](/Kobold "Kobold") are small; their weapon restrictions are listed in the table above.

- [Ogres](/Ogre "Ogre") and [Trolls](/Troll "Troll") are large species.

- All other races are medium species.

  - [Nagas](/Naga "Naga") and [Palentongas](/Palentonga "Palentonga") have large bodies but with medium torsos, so don't get any special access to weapons.
  - [Formicids](/Formicid "Formicid") are medium, though they can wield [giant clubs](/Giant_club "Giant club") and [giant spiked clubs](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club"), but not [large rocks](/Large_rock "Large rock").

## Shields

[Shields](/Shields "Shields") can be worn while wielding one handed weapons. Shields provide [SH](/SH "SH"), in exchange for a penalty to EV, attack speed, and spellcasting. They also disable the offhand punch [auxiliary attack](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack"). [Octopodes](/Octopode "Octopode") have an offhand slap that can be done even if holding a shield.

With the exception of [Felid](/Felid "Felid"), anyone can wear a shield, though with varying extents. [Formicids](/Formicid "Formicid") have four strong arms, so (except for both [giant clubs](/Giant_club "Giant club")) can wield a two-handed weapon and a shield. Everyone else, including the 8-tentacled [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode"), are limited to one-handers.

- [Spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") and [Kobolds](/Kobold "Kobold") are more encumbered by a shield, and can not wear [tower shields](/Tower_shield "Tower shield"). Spriggans can't use [kite shields](/Kite_shield "Kite shield"), either.
- [Ogres](/Ogre "Ogre") and [Trolls](/Troll "Troll") find bucklers too small for them, though have reduced shield penalties.
- [Nagas](/Naga "Naga"), [Palentongas](/Palentonga "Palentonga"), and [Formicids](/Formicid "Formicid") have no shield restrictions, but also find shields easier to wield.

## Rings

[Ru](/Ru "Ru")'s Sacrifice Hand disables a [ring](/Ring "Ring") slot, in addition to the loss of two-handed weapons, shields, and the offhand punch.

While [Formicids](/Formicid "Formicid") have 4 arms, two of them are oddly shaped; they have two "hand-pairs", so have two ring slots. Under Sacrifice Hand, they lose the shield slot and offhand punch but can stil wield two-handed weapons.

## History

- In [0.18](/0.18 "0.18") throwing delays followed the throwing skill dependency improvements like other weapons. Before this thrown missiles used the unarmed combat skill and were not impacted by wearing a shield.
- In the [0.14.2](/0.14 "0.14") bug fix release transformations no longer allow the character to wield too-large weapons.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), there were two additional types of handedness: 1.5-handed (which could be used with a shield but suffered larger-than-normal penalties) and double-handed (which had even worse penalties, plus cut the weapon's base damage in half).

Version 0.29: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Each weapon has a particular handedness, which determines how well you can wield it based on your size, and whether or not you can use a shield.

  • Felids lack opposable thumbs and cannot wield weapons, throw items, or evoke magical staves.
  • Spriggans are little and Kobolds are small; their weapon restrictions are listed in the table above.
  • Ogres and Trolls are large species.
  • All other races are medium species.
    • Nagas and Palentongas have large bodies but with medium torsos, so don't get any special access to weapons.
    • Formicids are medium, though they can wield giant clubs and giant spiked clubs, but not large rocks.

Shields

Shields can be worn while wielding one handed weapons. Shields provide SH, in exchange for a penalty to EV, attack speed, and spellcasting. They also disable the offhand punch auxiliary attack. Octopodes have an offhand slap that can be done even if holding a shield.

With the exception of Felid, anyone can wear a shield, though with varying extents. Formicids have four strong arms, so (except for both giant clubs) can wield a two-handed weapon and a shield. Everyone else, including the 8-tentacled Octopode, are limited to one-handers.

  • Spriggans and Kobolds are more encumbered by a shield, and can not wear tower shields. Spriggans can't use kite shields, either.
  • Ogres and Trolls find bucklers too small for them, though have reduced shield penalties.
  • Nagas, Palentongas, and Formicids have no shield restrictions, but also find shields easier to wield.

Rings

Ru's Sacrifice Hand disables a ring slot, in addition to the loss of two-handed weapons, shields, and the offhand punch.

While Formicids have 4 arms, two of them are oddly shaped; they have two "hand-pairs", so have two ring slots. Under Sacrifice Hand, they lose the shield slot and offhand punch but can stil wield two-handed weapons.

History

  • In 0.18 throwing delays followed the throwing skill dependency improvements like other weapons. Before this thrown missiles used the unarmed combat skill and were not impacted by wearing a shield.
  • In the 0.14.2 bug fix release transformations no longer allow the character to wield too-large weapons.
  • Prior to 0.12, there were two additional types of handedness: 1.5-handed (which could be used with a shield but suffered larger-than-normal penalties) and double-handed (which had even worse penalties, plus cut the weapon's base damage in half).
